title: Change versioning of development releases
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/108

Currently we use a so called "local version" from [PEP 440](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0440/). An example tarball is: `lfortran-0.0+gitb9ebb38.tar.gz` (one can get the full link from https://lfortran.org/download/). This can be installed by:
```
pip install https://lfortran.github.io/tarballs/dev/lfortran-0.0+gitb9ebb38.tar.gz
```
and that works, but the version looks ugly, and the tarball cannot be uploaded to the Test PyPI. A better approach is to use a version like `lfortran-0.1.14.dev3.tar.gz`, where `dev3` means 3 commits from the last `0.1.14` release. Our download page would still link the exact commit for each development release, so that one can go easily between the git commit on gitlab and a tarball.

Then such development releases can be uploaded into Test PyPI, which could be useful for testing, before we tag a commit for a release.
